title: parser error hint: generic type parameters do not need dereferences

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:
```
fn size<*const T>(_v: *const T) {
    println!("{:?}", std::mem::size_of::<T>());
}
size(0 as *const u8);
```

I expected to see this happen: 
```
| expected one of `#`, `>`, `const`, identifier, or lifetime. function generic type parameters `<>` do not need dereferences.
= help: For a dereferenced type use parameter `<T>`, dereferenced type `T`, and pointer type `*const T` or `*mut T` as appropriate
```

Instead, this happened:
```| expected one of `#`, `>`, `const`, identifier, or lifetime```

### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.48.0-nightly (d006f5734 2020-08-28)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: d006f5734f49625c34d6fc33bf6b9967243abca8
commit-date: 2020-08-28
host: i686-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.48.0-nightly
LLVM version: 11.0
```
